column4: hey there guys, whats the easiest way to find out what port a webpage is being served on ?
or can say secure webpages ONLY be served from port 443?
i thought secure pages are supposed to port 81
for example the page I wanted to find out info on ...WAS on port 443 :)
google for ports and find whats supposed to be on port 443
well he could edit his fstab but I didnt want to go into that.
i was referring to mounting it off the rootfs :)
well I used suse too long I guess
either mount it in /media or /mnt.../media is my personal preference :)
how do you even know what your drinking when you mix it with that garbage?
gmailfs is fine and dandy for those that can get it working
I didnt really find gmailfs that useful when I had it, I just like gmail as my email client
